SUVs have gained popularity due to shifting consumer preferences towards vehicles that offer versatility, space, and a higher driving position. Many consumers perceive SUVs as more practical for various lifestyles, including families, outdoor enthusiasts, and urban commuters. The desire for vehicles capable of accommodating passengers, cargo, and diverse road conditions has driven the demand for SUVs. For Instance, in March 2024, the Peugeot E-5008 made headlines by setting a new standard as the sole all-electric SUV boasting spacious accommodation for up to 7 passengers and an impressive electric range of up to 660 km. Built upon the STLA Medium platform and equipped with a domestically manufactured battery, the E-5008 caters perfectly to the demands of customers seeking a sizable SUV with a bold design, inviting interior, and efficient electric performance. Peugeot ensures complete peace of mind for its clientele by offering the E-5008 with 8 years or 160,000 km coverage through its ALLURE CARE program. Crafted as an electric model from inception, the new E-5008 features a selection of zero-emission motors (WLTP cycles pending approval), ranging from 500 to 660 km in electric range, including an AWD Dual Motor and a Long-Range variant. With advancements in technology, SUVs have become more fuel-efficient compared to their predecessors. Automakers have introduced hybrid and electric SUV models to address environmental concerns and comply with stricter emissions regulations. For instance, in March 2024, BMW unveiled its plan to reveal the Vision Neue Klasse X SUV on March 21st, 2024. This model marks the latest addition to the company's electric SUV lineup, evident from the inclusion of the 'X' designation in its name, signifying its connection to BMW's existing X range of SUVs. The upcoming electric SUV not only represents a glimpse into BMW's forthcoming SUV offerings but also serves as a precursor to its future SUV lineup. Forming a part of BMW's Neue Klasse EV platform , this concept SUV will serve as the foundation for six new vehicles set to debut by 2025. Among these releases is a robust five-seater SUV set to follow in the footsteps of the iX3. Additionally, the perception of SUVs as safer vehicles due to their size and robust construction has contributed to their sustained popularity despite concerns about fuel consumption and emissions. However, despite advancements in fuel efficiency and the emergence of electric SUVs, environmental concerns regarding greenhouse gas emissions and fuel consumption remain significant. Stricter emissions regulations imposed by governments worldwide may limit the appeal of traditional gas-powered SUVs, leading to increased scrutiny and potential restrictions on their sales and usage. SUV Market Trends Expansion of hybrid and plug-in hybrid SUV offerings could emerge as a key factor strengthening the SUV industry. Hybrid and plug-in hybrid SUVs are gaining popularity as a transitional solution for consumers who want improved fuel efficiency without fully committing to electric vehicles. by Type (Sub-Compact, Compact, Mid-size, Full-size and MPV), Propulsion (Internal Combustion Engine, Hybrid and Electric Vehicles) and Region (North America,Europe and Asia-Pacific) - Forecast 2030" report has been added to ResearchAndMarkets.com\'s offering. The SUV market is projected to reach 53 million units by 2030 from 41 million units in 2024, at a CAGR of 4.4%. The report will help the market leaders/new entrants in this market with information on the closest approximations of the sales numbers for the SUVs and their subsegments. This report will help stakeholders understand the competitive landscape and gain more insights to position their businesses better and to plan suitable go-to-market strategies. The report also helps stakeholders understand the pulse of the market and provides them with information on key market drivers, restraints, challenges, and opportunities. The SUV market is expected to experience growth driven by various factors. The automotive industry is currently under constant pressure to adapt to new changes due to technological advancements and end-user preferences. Adoption of electric SUVs is the key factor that has witnessed a rapid change in the SUVs market. In line with the EV sector, development and manufacturing of long-range batteries along with installation of fast and ultra-fast charging points for customers is the foremost agenda of the OEMs and EV solution providing companies. Further, the introduction of autonomous SUVs with enhanced safety features and higher level of automation is shifting the trends in the SUV market. Moreover, OEMs are focused on reducing the production cost of the vehicle by standadizing the platform technology and planning & developing unique platforms for all the SUVs under their brand. Furthermore, Fuel Cell Electric Vehicle (FCEV) SUVs can be a major break-through in the SUVs market. Although the FCEV technology is still in the initial stages, planned research & development is carried out and can become a next major factor in the overall automotive industry, SUVs included. In addition, the current HEVs and BEVs are rapidly growing as several countries in Europe have put forth a strict plan for achieving ZEV targets. EV segment growth to 2030 The BEV, HEV and PHEV segments are expected to lead the SUV market during the forecast period. The growth of EVs is due to the Euro-7 implementation and ICE ban timelines. This has led to new EV SUV launches in 2022 and 2023. Similarly, over 20 new models of electric vehicles are set to launch in 2024 & 2025. This will lead to rapid adoption of EVs SUVs over ICE SUVs. Moreover, long range powered batteries and fast charging public points will lead to overcoming the major restraining factors of the EV market growth. For instance, in December 2023, Toyota launched a new long range Crown Sport PHEV model to cater the Japanese market. Similarly, market leaders such as BMW, Mercedes-Benz and Telsa amongst others have launched long range BEV models in different regional markets in the past two years. Having said that the volume of HEV will rise but till 2030 and will be stagnant for some years and then decline gradually to be replaced by BEVs. This will majorly happen due to the current limited range of the batteries and need to frequently charge the batteries during long distance travel, which will not be an restraint during 2030s. Autonomous SUVs are anticipated to witness growth Autonomous SUVs are projected to grow significantly during the forecast due to the rising demand for safety, comfort, and driving convenience features. Description Table of Contents The India SUV market was valued at USD 18.13 Billion in 2024 and is expected to reach USD 33.85 Billion by 2030 with a CAGR of 10.97% during the forecast period. The India SUV market is witnessing remarkable growth, driven by changing consumer preferences and a rising middle class. As families and urban residents increasingly favor SUVs for their perceived safety, spaciousness, and versatility, the demand for these vehicles continues to soar. By Shruti Shiraguppi 20 May 2025 3837 Views Share - In India's automotive discourse, a common lament echoes through industry analysis: SUVs have killed the beloved small car. While this narrative captures part of the truthhatchback segment share has indeed plummeted from 34.0% in Q4FY2023 to just 24.0% in Q4FY2025it misses a more nuanced reality emerging in the market. Within the SUV segment itself, a fascinating inverse relationship between vehicle size and growth rate has emerged, with smaller SUVs dramatically outperforming their larger counterparts. Shipment data reveals a striking pattern: in FY2025, growth rates across SUV categories almost perfectly correlate inversely with vehicle size. As SUVs get smaller, their market performance gets strongerchallenging conventional wisdom about India's automotive future. The Inverse Correlation: Size vs. Growth in India's SUV Market The data tells a compelling story of how SUV growth rates in FY2025 demonstrate an almost perfect inverse relationship with vehicle size: Micro SUVs (< 4m) : 20.4% year-over-year growth Compact SUVs (< 4m) : 13.5% year-over-year growth Mid SUVs (> 4m) : 9.8% year-over-year growth Large SUVs (> 4m) : 6.1% year-over-year growth Premium SUVs : 10.0% year-over-year decline This pattern suggests that while SUVs as a category are flourishing, consumer preferences are skewing decisively toward more accessible, compact offeringsa trend that runs counter to the perception of relentless upsizing in the Indian market. Micro SUVs (< 4m): The Explosive Growth Segment Market Performance The Micro SUV segment registered the highest growth in FY2025 at a remarkable 20.4% year-over-year, with sales surging from 424,197 units in FY2024 to 510,793 units in FY2025. This segment now commands 11.8% of the total passenger vehicle market, up from 10.1% in the previous fiscal year. Popular Models Key models driving this growth include the Tata Punch, Maruti Suzuki Fronx, Hyundai Exter, Nissan Magnite, and Renault Kiger. These vehicles typically offer SUV styling, higher ground clearance, and feature-rich cabins in a sub-4 meter footprint. Vendor Performance Tata Motors : Maintains segment leadership with the Punch, commanding 38.5% market share in FY2025, though slightly down from 39.8% in FY2024. Maruti Suzuki : Strengthened its position with the Fronx, increasing market share to 32.5% in FY2025 from 31.8% in FY2024. Hyundai : Captured 15.2% market share with the Exter, though down from 16.8% in FY2024. Toyota : New entrant to the segment in FY2025, quickly securing 5.8% market share. Nissan-Renault : Combined share declined from 10.2% to 7.5%, suggesting challenges in maintaining momentum against newer competitors. Compact SUVs (< 4m): Solid Growth Continues Market Performance Compact SUVs posted strong 13.5% year-over-year growth in FY2025, with volumes increasing from 614,009 units to 697,013 units. This segment represents 16.1% of the total passenger vehicle market, up from 14.6% in FY2024. The Mahindra XUV 3XO might be the car youre searching for! Lets dive into a detailed review to see what this model brings in 2025. Design and Exterior Highlights One look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO, especially in black, and its clear that this car is a head-turner. Its sporty design elements stand out with: Chrome Accents: The grille and headlamp finish feature stylish chrome highlights. Projector Headlamps with LED DRLs: These enhance visibility and aesthetics. Diamond-Cut Alloy Wheels: The 16-inch alloys add a premium feel to the vehicle. Safety Ratings: With six airbags and a five-star Global NCAP safety rating, this vehicle excels in safety. Roof Rails & Spoilers: Gloss-black roof rails and a sleek spoiler give it a bold presence on the road. Although the car lacks front parking sensors and certain accessories come as add-ons, its robust styling and road presence more than makes up for these minor drawbacks. Interior Comfort and Technology Step inside the Mahindra XUV 3XO, and youll be greeted by a modern and comfortable cabin: Dual-Tone Dashboard: Soft-touch materials on the doors and satin finishes on the levers add a premium touch. Advanced Infotainment System: A 10.25-inch infotainment display paired with a 10.25-inch digital instrument cluster ensures seamless access to information and entertainment. Steering Controls: A three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel includes controls for cruise and infotainment systems. Comfort Features: From automatic climate control with dual-zone functionality to wireless charging and a vanity mirror with illumination, convenience is a priority. While its disappointing that the glovebox isnt cooled or illuminated, the XUV 3XO compensates with thoughtful features like rear AC vents, adjustable headrests, and ample storage options. Performance and Engine Specifications Under the hood, the Mahindra XUV 3XO packs a punch with its turbocharged petrol engine: Engine Options: It comes with a 1.2-liter three-cylinder MPFI engine, delivering 109 BHP and 200 Nm of torque. Transmission: Choose between manual and automatic transmissions, depending on your driving preference. Fuel Efficiency: Mahindra claims an ARAI-certified mileage of 18.5 km/l, though real-world figures hover around 14-15 km/l. The cars ride quality, stability, and safety features like ABS with EBD, electronic stability control, and tyre pressure monitoring ensure a secure driving experience. Practicality and Storage With a 364-liter boot space, the XUV 3XO offers decent storage capacity. However, operating the boot can feel a bit cumbersome due to its electromagnetic button placement. The spare wheel, tool kit, and first-aid essentials are neatly arranged but require some effort to access. Final Thoughts The Mahindra XUV 3XO is an impressive contender in the compact SUV segment. While it has its minor quirks, the blend of safety, design, and performance makes it a strong value-for-money option in its price range. Would we recommend it? Absolutely! Add it to your shortlist and take it for a spin to see if its the perfect fit for your needs. Dont forget to share your thoughts on this versatile vehicle in the comments section! 98,091 unit sales in FY2024-25 as against 53,962 units with a YoY sales surge of 82 per cent Toward the end of May 2024, Mahindra kicked off deliveries for the XUV 3XO by rolling out 1,500 units across the country on day one. Over 50,000 reservations poured in within the first hour of official booking commencement and as close to 70 per cent of those early bookings leaned toward the petrol-powered versions of the compact SUV. Since its arrival, the Mahindra XUV 3XO has played a major role in driving the brands monthly numbers. The launch month of May 2024 saw 10,000 units dispatched, setting a strong tone right from the start. That initial push didnt taper off either August 2024 recorded a healthy 9,000 units, a significant jump from the 4,992 units sold during the same period in the previous year. The sub-four-metre SUV managed to hold its ground in a crowded segment, consistently pulling in solid volumes month after month. It recorded 98,091 unit sales in FY2024-25 (April 2024 to March 2025 period) as against 53,962 units during the same period the previous fiscal to witness a massive surge in volume of 82 per cent highest amongst top-selling SUVs. Also Read:Tata Overtakes Mahindra & Hyundai In March 2025 Sales FADA It was also the tenth most sold SUV in India in the last FY. Compared to the XUV 300, the rebranded XUV 3XO received several changes. The thoroughly redesigned exterior was accompanied by a more modern interior with a heavily upgraded features list while one of its biggest achilles heel, the lack of bootspace was also addressed. Mahindra has equipped the XUV 3XO with a trio of engine options aimed at offering variety to a wide range of buyers. The standard 1.2-litre turbo petrol puts out 115 PS and 200 Nm while a more potent 1.2-litre direct injection version steps things up to 130 PS and 250 Nm. For those leaning toward diesel, the 1.5-litre four-cylinder unit churns out 117 PS along with a meaty 300 Nm of torque. Also Read:Mahindra XEV 9e & BE 6 Waiting Period Goes Up To 6 Months Transmission duties are handled by either a six-speed manual, a six-speed AMT, or a six-speed torque converter auto, depending on the variant. The equipment list comprises six airbags, a panoramic sunroof, a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system, a 10.25-inch digital instrument console, wireless charger, a seven-speaker Harman Kardon audio, automatic climate control and more. Mahindra BE 6 and XEV 9e Mahindras BE 6 and XEV 9e electric SUVs have been gaining momentum in domestic markets. The company is now set to initiate deliveries of Pack Two of these two electric SUVs from later this month. XEV 9e sales stood at 2,808 units last month while the company also sold 1,203 units of the BE 6. Mahindra Sales Breakup June 2025 MoM Comparison Lower sales were reported for the XUV400 of which only 231 units were sold last month. This related to a 57% YoY and 20% MoM decline. Mahindra Marazzo, on the other hand, has seen outstanding improvement in demand. It was the only model in the company portfolio to post both YoY and MoM growth and that too by a huge percentage. Marazzo sales grew by 42% YoY to 17 units from just 12 unit sales of June 2024. It showed exceptional MoM improvement by 325% when compared to just 4 units sold as of May 2025. Mahindra Sales Breakup Q2 CY 2025 Mahindra Sales Breakup Q2 CY 2025 Mahindra has posted an impressive 22.39% year-on-year growth in overall sales for Q2 CY 2025, selling 1,52,067 units compared to 1,24,248 units in Q2 CY 2024. Leading the charge is the Scorpio/N with 42,675 units, while the Thar/ROXX range more than doubled its sales, growing by a strong 77.22% YoY. The newly introduced electric models, XEV 9e and BE 6, contributed significantly with 8,064 and 2,959 units respectively. The XUV 3XO and XUV700 also showed stable performances, with modest but positive growth. However, legacy models like the Bolero and XUV400 EV saw slight declines, the latter dropping by nearly 46% YoY. Overall, the addition of new EVs and strong SUV demand helped Mahindra achieve a solid quarter. With an all-SUV portfolio, M&M has, since FY2022 when it sold 225,895 units, successfully surfed the wave of surging demand for most of its models. In FY2025, in terms of model-wise share of sales, the Scorpio twins and the 3XO compact SUV achieved their best-ever fiscal year numbers, together contributing 48% of the company's best-ever fiscal wholesales. The 3XO compact SUV sold 100,906 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% and an additional 46,180 unitsYoY the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. The Scorpio sold an additional 23,380 units in FY2025 compared to FY2024. The Mahindra Scorpio twins have had a stellar FY2025. The best-selling Mahindra model the Scorpio N and Scorpio Classic together sold 164,842 units, up 17% YoY (FY2024: 141,462 units), which translates into an additional 23,380 units. The Scorpio N and Classics share of total M&M sales works out to 30%, marginally down from the 31% in FY2024. The fuel-wise split for Scorpio sales in FY2025 is 93% diesel ( 153,395 units) and 7% petrol (11,447 units). The XUV 3XO , which is the reborn avatar of the XUV300, is the model which really provided the fireworks in terms of additional YoY sales. The compact SUV sold 100,923 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% YoY (FY2024: 54,726 units) this is an additional 46,197 units and the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. This stellar market performance means the XUV 3XOs share of company sales jumped to 18% from 12% in FY2024. The Mahindra Bolero brand, comprising the Bolero, Bolero Neo and Bolero Neo Plus, sold an estimated 94,750 units in FY2025, down 15% YoY (FY2024: 110,841 units). Flagship SUV Mahindra XUV700 continues to witness strong demand. At 93,082 units, sales were up 17% YoY (FY2024: 79,398 units), giving the model a 17% share, the same as in FY2024. In FY2024, the XUV700s 79,398 units were split between 71% diesel (56,366 units) and 29% petrol (23,032 units). report_sections.heading: Executive Summary
report_sections.content: The SUV market has experienced substantial growth globally, driven by increasing consumer preferences for versatile, spacious, and safe vehicles. The Indian SUV market is also witnessing significant expansion, fueled by a rising middle class, improved road infrastructure, and technological advancements in vehicles. Mahindra & Mahindra, a leading Indian automotive manufacturer, has introduced the XUV 3XO, a compact SUV designed to cater to the evolving needs of urban and rural consumers. This report provides a comprehensive analysis of the SUV market, with a focus on the Mahindra XUV 3XO, its key features, safety and luxury aspects, and sales performance.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section offers a high-level overview of the SUV market and the Mahindra XUV 3XO, setting the context for the detailed analysis that follows.
bullet_points: Global SUV market is projected to reach USD 1,221.7 billion by 2027, growing at a CAGR of 6.6%.
The Indian SUV market was valued at USD 8.6 billion in 2022 and is projected to reach USD 10.2 billion by 2032.
Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV targeting urban and rural consumers with its versatile features and design.
The XUV 3XO has achieved impressive sales figures since its launch, contributing significantly to Mahindra's overall sales.

report_sections.heading: SUV Market Analysis
report_sections.content: The global SUV market is driven by several factors, including changing consumer lifestyles, increasing disposable incomes, and the desire for vehicles with higher ground clearance and advanced safety features. Compact and subcompact SUVs are gaining popularity due to their affordability and fuel efficiency. The rise of electric and hybrid SUVs is also reshaping the industry, with major brands investing heavily in sustainable technologies. In India, the SUV market is characterized by a growing demand for both petrol and diesel-powered SUVs, with a recent surge in the adoption of electric vehicles.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section provides an in-depth analysis of the SUV market, including market drivers, trends, and regional insights.
bullet_points: Increasing consumer preference for versatile and spacious vehicles.
Growing demand for compact and subcompact SUVs due to affordability.
Rise of electric and hybrid SUVs as environmentally friendly alternatives.
Expanding road infrastructure and urbanization driving SUV sales in India.

report_sections.heading: Mahindra XUV 3XO Features
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to offer a blend of style, comfort, and performance. Key features include a striking exterior with LED DRLs and headlamps, a comfortable interior with premium leatherette seats, and smart connectivity with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system. The XUV 3XO also boasts a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation, along with built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. It also includes Level 2 ADAS. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section details the key features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, highlighting its design, interior, connectivity, and performance aspects.
bullet_points: Striking exterior design with LED DRLs and headlamps.
Comfortable interior with premium leatherette seats and Skyroof.
Smart connectivity with Harman Kardon audio system and touchscreen infotainment.
1.2L mStallion TCMPFi engine delivering a power of 82 kW and torque of 200 Nm.

report_sections.heading: Luxury and Safety Features
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO prioritizes safety with features such as six airbags, ESC with Hill Hold Control (HHC), and All 4 Disc Brakes. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including Level 2 ADAS. Level 2 ADAS includes forward collision warning, adaptive cruise control, traffic sign recognition and more. The vehicle has also received a five-star safety rating in the Bharat NCAP crash tests, making it one of the safest options in its category.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section provides a detailed analysis of the luxury and safety features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, highlighting its technologies, materials, and safety ratings.
bullet_points: Six airbags, ESC with Hill Hold Control (HHC), and All 4 Disc Brakes for enhanced safety.

Five-star safety rating in the Bharat NCAP crash tests.
Panoramic sunroof and advanced infotainment options in the AX7 Luxury variant.

report_sections.heading: Sales Data and Trends
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO has achieved impressive sales figures since its launch. In June 2025, the total sales figure was 7,089 units. Mahindra XUV 3XO achieved a sales milestone of 79,208 units in the Indian market over the past 12 months. The XUV 3XO posted 98,091 unit sales in FY2024-25, with a YoY sales surge of 82%.

Mahindra XUV 3XO Analysis Report

Executive Summary

The SUV market has experienced substantial growth globally, driven by increasing consumer preferences for versatile, spacious, and safe vehicles. The Indian SUV market is also witnessing significant expansion, fueled by a rising middle class, improved road infrastructure, and technological advancements in vehicles. Mahindra & Mahindra, a leading Indian automotive manufacturer, has introduced the XUV 3XO, a compact SUV designed to cater to the evolving needs of urban and rural consumers. This report provides a comprehensive analysis of the SUV market, with a focus on the Mahindra XUV 3XO, its key features, safety and luxury aspects, and sales performance.

This section offers a high-level overview of the SUV market and the Mahindra XUV 3XO, setting the context for the detailed analysis that follows.

  • Global SUV market is projected to reach USD 1,221.7 billion by 2027, growing at a CAGR of 6.6%.
  • The Indian SUV market was valued at USD 8.6 billion in 2022 and is projected to reach USD 10.2 billion by 2032.
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV targeting urban and rural consumers with its versatile features and design.
  • The XUV 3XO has achieved impressive sales figures since its launch, contributing significantly to Mahindra's overall sales.

SUV Market Analysis

The global SUV market is driven by several factors, including changing consumer lifestyles, increasing disposable incomes, and the desire for vehicles with higher ground clearance and advanced safety features. Compact and subcompact SUVs are gaining popularity due to their affordability and fuel efficiency. The rise of electric and hybrid SUVs is also reshaping the industry, with major brands investing heavily in sustainable technologies. In India, the SUV market is characterized by a growing demand for both petrol and diesel-powered SUVs, with a recent surge in the adoption of electric vehicles.

This section provides an in-depth analysis of the SUV market, including market drivers, trends, and regional insights.

  • Increasing consumer preference for versatile and spacious vehicles.
  • Growing demand for compact and subcompact SUVs due to affordability.
  • Rise of electric and hybrid SUVs as environmentally friendly alternatives.
  • Expanding road infrastructure and urbanization driving SUV sales in India.

Mahindra XUV 3XO Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to offer a blend of style, comfort, and performance. Key features include a striking exterior with LED DRLs and headlamps, a comfortable interior with premium leatherette seats, and smart connectivity with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system. The XUV 3XO also boasts a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation, along with built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. It also includes Level 2 ADAS. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look.

This section details the key features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, highlighting its design, interior, connectivity, and performance aspects.

  • Striking exterior design with LED DRLs and headlamps.
  • Comfortable interior with premium leatherette seats and Skyroof.
  • Smart connectivity with Harman Kardon audio system and touchscreen infotainment.
  • 1.2L mStallion TCMPFi engine delivering a power of 82 kW and torque of 200 Nm.

Luxury and Safety Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO prioritizes safety with features such as six airbags, ESC with Hill Hold Control (HHC), and All 4 Disc Brakes. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including Level 2 ADAS. Level 2 ADAS includes forward collision warning, adaptive cruise control, traffic sign recognition and more. The vehicle has also received a five-star safety rating in the Bharat NCAP crash tests, making it one of the safest options in its category.

This section provides a detailed analysis of the luxury and safety features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, highlighting its technologies, materials, and safety ratings.

  • Six airbags, ESC with Hill Hold Control (HHC), and All 4 Disc Brakes for enhanced safety.
  • Level 2 ADAS with features like adaptive cruise control and traffic sign recognition.
  • Five-star safety rating in the Bharat NCAP crash tests.
  • Panoramic sunroof and advanced infotainment options in the AX7 Luxury variant.

To know about the assumptions considered for the study, Request for Free Sample Report SUV Market Dynamics DRIVER: The rise in demand for premium vehicles with advanced comfort features The improving global economic conditions have changed the overall lifestyle of consumers. Consumers' preferences have changed due to rising disposable income, and their demands have changed in line with modern lifestyles. This has favorably affected the sales of ultra-luxurious cars across the globe. In addition to this, demand for luxury cars can be attributed to factors such as comfort, convenience, entertainment, safety features, luxury cars equipped with advanced connectivity elements, autonomous-driving options, and the latest powertrain electrification technologies. In line with growing luxury vehicles, the market for premium SUVs has risen significantly recently. According to MarketsandMarkets Analysis, of total premium cars produced globally, the share of premium SUVs stood at ~53% in 2016, which grew to ~62% in 2021. Countries such as the US, Canada, China, Japan, and South Korea lead the premium SUVs market, constituting more than 90% of total production globally. For instance, in 2021, the production of luxury SUVs in the US out of total luxury cars was around 75%. On the other hand, developing countries such as China, Brazil, and India have shown tremendous growth in SUVs demand during previous years. China and India's market has grown by ~36% and ~10%, respectively, from 2018 to 2021. RESTRAINT: High cost of SUV SUVs offer various benefits over hatchback and sedan cars, and buyers have moved towards this vehicle segment. According to IEA, global SUV sales had grown remarkably by more than 10% between 2020 and 2021, accounting for more than 45% of all new car sales globally. SUVs have gained popularity due to shifting consumer preferences towards vehicles that offer versatility, space, and a higher driving position. Many consumers perceive SUVs as more practical for various lifestyles, including families, outdoor enthusiasts, and urban commuters. The desire for vehicles capable of accommodating passengers, cargo, and diverse road conditions has driven the demand for SUVs. For Instance, in March 2024, the Peugeot E-5008 made headlines by setting a new standard as the sole all-electric SUV boasting spacious accommodation for up to 7 passengers and an impressive electric range of up to 660 km. Built upon the STLA Medium platform and equipped with a domestically manufactured battery, the E-5008 caters perfectly to the demands of customers seeking a sizable SUV with a bold design, inviting interior, and efficient electric performance. Peugeot ensures complete peace of mind for its clientele by offering the E-5008 with 8 years or 160,000 km coverage through its ALLURE CARE program. Crafted as an electric model from inception, the new E-5008 features a selection of zero-emission motors (WLTP cycles pending approval), ranging from 500 to 660 km in electric range, including an AWD Dual Motor and a Long-Range variant. With advancements in technology, SUVs have become more fuel-efficient compared to their predecessors. Automakers have introduced hybrid and electric SUV models to address environmental concerns and comply with stricter emissions regulations. This model marks the latest addition to the company's electric SUV lineup, evident from the inclusion of the 'X' designation in its name, signifying its connection to BMW's existing X range of SUVs. The upcoming electric SUV not only represents a glimpse into BMW's forthcoming SUV offerings but also serves as a precursor to its future SUV lineup. Among these releases is a robust five-seater SUV set to follow in the footsteps of the iX3. Additionally, the perception of SUVs as safer vehicles due to their size and robust construction has contributed to their sustained popularity despite concerns about fuel consumption and emissions. The SUV market is projected to reach 53 million units by 2030 from 41 million units in 2024, at a CAGR of 4.4%. The report will help the market leaders/new entrants in this market with information on the closest approximations of the sales numbers for the SUVs and their subsegments. This report will help stakeholders understand the competitive landscape and gain more insights to position their businesses better and to plan suitable go-to-market strategies. The report also helps stakeholders understand the pulse of the market and provides them with information on key market drivers, restraints, challenges, and opportunities. The SUV market is expected to experience growth driven by various factors. The automotive industry is currently under constant pressure to adapt to new changes due to technological advancements and end-user preferences. Adoption of electric SUVs is the key factor that has witnessed a rapid change in the SUVs market. In line with the EV sector, development and manufacturing of long-range batteries along with installation of fast and ultra-fast charging points for customers is the foremost agenda of the OEMs and EV solution providing companies. Further, the introduction of autonomous SUVs with enhanced safety features and higher level of automation is shifting the trends in the SUV market. Moreover, OEMs are focused on reducing the production cost of the vehicle by standadizing the platform technology and planning & developing unique platforms for all the SUVs under their brand. Furthermore, Fuel Cell Electric Vehicle (FCEV) SUVs can be a major break-through in the SUVs market. Although the FCEV technology is still in the initial stages, planned research & development is carried out and can become a next major factor in the overall automotive industry, SUVs included. In addition, the current HEVs and BEVs are rapidly growing as several countries in Europe have put forth a strict plan for achieving ZEV targets. EV segment growth to 2030 The BEV, HEV and PHEV segments are expected to lead the SUV market during the forecast period. The growth of EVs is due to the Euro-7 implementation and ICE ban timelines. This has led to new EV SUV launches in 2022 and 2023. Similarly, over 20 new models of electric vehicles are set to launch in 2024 & 2025. This will lead to rapid adoption of EVs SUVs over ICE SUVs. Moreover, long range powered batteries and fast charging public points will lead to overcoming the major restraining factors of the EV market growth. For instance, in December 2023, Toyota launched a new long range Crown Sport PHEV model to cater the Japanese market. Similarly, market leaders such as BMW, Mercedes-Benz and Telsa amongst others have launched long range BEV models in different regional markets in the past two years. Having said that the volume of HEV will rise but till 2030 and will be stagnant for some years and then decline gradually to be replaced by BEVs. This will majorly happen due to the current limited range of the batteries and need to frequently charge the batteries during long distance travel, which will not be an restraint during 2030s. Autonomous SUVs are anticipated to witness growth Autonomous SUVs are projected to grow significantly during the forecast due to the rising demand for safety, comfort, and driving convenience features. By Shruti Shiraguppi 20 May 2025 3837 Views Share - In India's automotive discourse, a common lament echoes through industry analysis: SUVs have killed the beloved small car. While this narrative captures part of the truthhatchback segment share has indeed plummeted from 34.0% in Q4FY2023 to just 24.0% in Q4FY2025it misses a more nuanced reality emerging in the market. Within the SUV segment itself, a fascinating inverse relationship between vehicle size and growth rate has emerged, with smaller SUVs dramatically outperforming their larger counterparts. Shipment data reveals a striking pattern: in FY2025, growth rates across SUV categories almost perfectly correlate inversely with vehicle size. As SUVs get smaller, their market performance gets strongerchallenging conventional wisdom about India's automotive future. The Inverse Correlation: Size vs. Growth in India's SUV Market The data tells a compelling story of how SUV growth rates in FY2025 demonstrate an almost perfect inverse relationship with vehicle size: Micro SUVs (< 4m) : 20.4% year-over-year growth Compact SUVs (< 4m) : 13.5% year-over-year growth Mid SUVs (> 4m) : 9.8% year-over-year growth Large SUVs (> 4m) : 6.1% year-over-year growth Premium SUVs : 10.0% year-over-year decline This pattern suggests that while SUVs as a category are flourishing, consumer preferences are skewing decisively toward more accessible, compact offeringsa trend that runs counter to the perception of relentless upsizing in the Indian market. Micro SUVs (< 4m): The Explosive Growth Segment Market Performance The Micro SUV segment registered the highest growth in FY2025 at a remarkable 20.4% year-over-year, with sales surging from 424,197 units in FY2024 to 510,793 units in FY2025. This segment now commands 11.8% of the total passenger vehicle market, up from 10.1% in the previous fiscal year. Popular Models Key models driving this growth include the Tata Punch, Maruti Suzuki Fronx, Hyundai Exter, Nissan Magnite, and Renault Kiger. These vehicles typically offer SUV styling, higher ground clearance, and feature-rich cabins in a sub-4 meter footprint. Vendor Performance Tata Motors : Maintains segment leadership with the Punch, commanding 38.5% market share in FY2025, though slightly down from 39.8% in FY2024. Maruti Suzuki : Strengthened its position with the Fronx, increasing market share to 32.5% in FY2025 from 31.8% in FY2024. Hyundai : Captured 15.2% market share with the Exter, though down from 16.8% in FY2024. Toyota : New entrant to the segment in FY2025, quickly securing 5.8% market share. Nissan-Renault : Combined share declined from 10.2% to 7.5%, suggesting challenges in maintaining momentum against newer competitors. Compact SUVs (< 4m): Solid Growth Continues Market Performance Compact SUVs posted strong 13.5% year-over-year growth in FY2025, with volumes increasing from 614,009 units to 697,013 units. This segment represents 16.1% of the total passenger vehicle market, up from 14.6% in FY2024. This unending obsession has made him opt for this love as a career option so that he never has to leave the sight of them, ever. KEY HIGHLIGHTS Mahindra XUV 3XO priced at Rs. 7.49 lakhs ex-showroom Facelift of the Mahindra XUV300 Clocked 50,000 bookings within first hour of commencement Mahindra XUV 3XO was launched at Rs. 7.49 lakhs and created a stir in the segment with a feature list that stood out in the space. With a refreshing cosmetic overhaul, trusted mechanics, and some very unique features, it managed to dwarf the top contenders in the segment with its massive booking spree and the demand that it generated. In this section, let's look at some very interesting and a few segment-first features that make this compact SUV stand out in the crowded market. Before we start, make sure to join our 91Wheels Whatsapp Channel to get all the latest buzz in and around the automotive world. Also Read- 2025 Tata Harrier EV Spied Testing: New Alloys, Features, And More Level 2 ADAS The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO comes with Level 2 ADAS which is a segment-first and hits the ball out out of the park. It offers forward collision warning, adaptive cruise control, traffic sign recognition, and more. This takes its safety quotient to another level. Interstingly, the XUV300 was a 5-star rated vehicle and it is also expected to score a full house with this one as well. Variants Available: Level 2 ADAS is available with the AX5 Luxury and the AX7 Luxury trims onwards starting at Rs. 12.24 lakhs ex-showroom. Competitors With Same Features: Hyundai Venue: Available exclusively with the SX(O) variant at Rs. 12.44 lakhs ex-showroom. Kia Sonet: Available from GTX+ and X-Line trims starting at Rs. 14.72 lakhs onwards Segment First Panoramic Sunroof Moving over the single-pane units, the XUV 3XO goes a length forward to offer another segment first, a panoramic sunroof which is a commendable addition to the segment. However, this might be a short-lived badge to donn as recent spy shots have revealed the Tata Nexon with a panoramic sunroof which could be introduced in a mid-cycle update. Variants Available: This panoramic sunroof is available with the AX7 and the AX7 L trim onwards at a starting price point of Rs. 12.49 lakhs. Competitors With the Same Features: None First In-Segment Steering Modes XUV300 offered this feature and the XUV 3XO continues to offer this unique feature of steering modes. It changes the feedback of steering according to your liking and driving style and is offered as standard across variants namely - sport, normal, and comfort modes. This is something that even higher-segment cars do not offer. Variants Available: As standard across variants Competitors With the Same Features: None First In-Segment Electronic Parking Brake Another segment's first feature is the electronic parking brake with an auto hold feature. Other rivals still offer the connections mechanical lever for this function. This uplifts the overall appeal inside the cabin and adds that premium touch. Variants Available: It is available only with the top-spec AX7 L trim at Rs. 13.99 lakhs. BIKES NEWS AUTO INDUSTRY NEWS MOD JOB Home Cars News Mahindra XUV 3XO Posted 82% Growth In FY25, Highest Among SUVs By Surendhar M - April 17, 2025 Pic Source: Hari Haran Mahindra XUV 3XO posted 98,091 unit sales in FY2024-25 as against 53,962 units with a YoY sales surge of 82 per cent Toward the end of May 2024, Mahindra kicked off deliveries for the XUV 3XO by rolling out 1,500 units across the country on day one. Over 50,000 reservations poured in within the first hour of official booking commencement and as close to 70 per cent of those early bookings leaned toward the petrol-powered versions of the compact SUV. Since its arrival, the Mahindra XUV 3XO has played a major role in driving the brands monthly numbers. The launch month of May 2024 saw 10,000 units dispatched, setting a strong tone right from the start. That initial push didnt taper off either August 2024 recorded a healthy 9,000 units, a significant jump from the 4,992 units sold during the same period in the previous year. The sub-four-metre SUV managed to hold its ground in a crowded segment, consistently pulling in solid volumes month after month. It recorded 98,091 unit sales in FY2024-25 (April 2024 to March 2025 period) as against 53,962 units during the same period the previous fiscal to witness a massive surge in volume of 82 per cent highest amongst top-selling SUVs. Also Read:Tata Overtakes Mahindra & Hyundai In March 2025 Sales FADA It was also the tenth most sold SUV in India in the last FY. Compared to the XUV 300, the rebranded XUV 3XO received several changes. The thoroughly redesigned exterior was accompanied by a more modern interior with a heavily upgraded features list while one of its biggest achilles heel, the lack of bootspace was also addressed. Mahindra has equipped the XUV 3XO with a trio of engine options aimed at offering variety to a wide range of buyers. The standard 1.2-litre turbo petrol puts out 115 PS and 200 Nm while a more potent 1.2-litre direct injection version steps things up to 130 PS and 250 Nm. For those leaning toward diesel, the 1.5-litre four-cylinder unit churns out 117 PS along with a meaty 300 Nm of torque. Also Read:Mahindra XEV 9e & BE 6 Waiting Period Goes Up To 6 Months Transmission duties are handled by either a six-speed manual, a six-speed AMT, or a six-speed torque converter auto, depending on the variant. The equipment list comprises six airbags, a panoramic sunroof, a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system, a 10.25-inch digital instrument console, wireless charger, a seven-speaker Harman Kardon audio, automatic climate control and more. By Ajit Dalvi 10 Apr 2025 7005 Views Share - Mahindra & Mahindra has driven into FY2026 on the back of a record fiscal. At 551,487 SUVs sold and robust 20% year-on-year growth (FY2024: 459,877 units), FY2025 was a bumper fiscal year for the company. With an all-SUV portfolio, M&M has, since FY2022 when it sold 225,895 units, successfully surfed the wave of surging demand for most of its models. In FY2025, in terms of model-wise share of sales, the Scorpio twins and the 3XO compact SUV achieved their best-ever fiscal year numbers, together contributing 48% of the company's best-ever fiscal wholesales. The 3XO compact SUV sold 100,906 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% and an additional 46,180 unitsYoY the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. The Scorpio sold an additional 23,380 units in FY2025 compared to FY2024. The Mahindra Scorpio twins have had a stellar FY2025. The best-selling Mahindra model the Scorpio N and Scorpio Classic together sold 164,842 units, up 17% YoY (FY2024: 141,462 units), which translates into an additional 23,380 units. The Scorpio N and Classics share of total M&M sales works out to 30%, marginally down from the 31% in FY2024. The fuel-wise split for Scorpio sales in FY2025 is 93% diesel ( 153,395 units) and 7% petrol (11,447 units). The XUV 3XO , which is the reborn avatar of the XUV300, is the model which really provided the fireworks in terms of additional YoY sales. The compact SUV sold 100,923 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% YoY (FY2024: 54,726 units) this is an additional 46,197 units and the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. This stellar market performance means the XUV 3XOs share of company sales jumped to 18% from 12% in FY2024. The Mahindra Bolero brand, comprising the Bolero, Bolero Neo and Bolero Neo Plus, sold an estimated 94,750 units in FY2025, down 15% YoY (FY2024: 110,841 units). This sales decline sees the Boleros share of M&M sales drop to 17% from 24% in FY2024. The Bolero is sold only with a diesel powertrain. Flagship SUV Mahindra XUV700 continues to witness strong demand. At 93,082 units, sales were up 17% YoY (FY2024: 79,398 units), giving the model a 17% share, the same as in FY2024. Year on year, an additional 27,836 units. The fuel-wise sales split for the XUV700 in FY2025 is 75% diesel ( 70,172 units) and 25% petrol (22,910 units). In FY2024, the XUV700s 79,398 units were split between 71% diesel (56,366 units) and 29% petrol (23,032 units). 98,091 unit sales in FY2024-25 as against 53,962 units with a YoY sales surge of 82 per cent Toward the end of May 2024, Mahindra kicked off deliveries for the XUV 3XO by rolling out 1,500 units across the country on day one. Over 50,000 reservations poured in within the first hour of official booking commencement and as close to 70 per cent of those early bookings leaned toward the petrol-powered versions of the compact SUV. Since its arrival, the Mahindra XUV 3XO has played a major role in driving the brands monthly numbers. The launch month of May 2024 saw 10,000 units dispatched, setting a strong tone right from the start. That initial push didnt taper off either August 2024 recorded a healthy 9,000 units, a significant jump from the 4,992 units sold during the same period in the previous year. The sub-four-metre SUV managed to hold its ground in a crowded segment, consistently pulling in solid volumes month after month. It recorded 98,091 unit sales in FY2024-25 (April 2024 to March 2025 period) as against 53,962 units during the same period the previous fiscal to witness a massive surge in volume of 82 per cent highest amongst top-selling SUVs. Compared to the XUV 300, the rebranded XUV 3XO received several changes. Mahindra has equipped the XUV 3XO with a trio of engine options aimed at offering variety to a wide range of buyers. The standard 1.2-litre turbo petrol puts out 115 PS and 200 Nm while a more potent 1.2-litre direct injection version steps things up to 130 PS and 250 Nm. For those leaning toward diesel, the 1.5-litre four-cylinder unit churns out 117 PS along with a meaty 300 Nm of torque. By Ajit Dalvi 10 Apr 2025 7005 Views Share - Mahindra & Mahindra has driven into FY2026 on the back of a record fiscal. At 551,487 SUVs sold and robust 20% year-on-year growth (FY2024: 459,877 units), FY2025 was a bumper fiscal year for the company. With an all-SUV portfolio, M&M has, since FY2022 when it sold 225,895 units, successfully surfed the wave of surging demand for most of its models. In FY2025, in terms of model-wise share of sales, the Scorpio twins and the 3XO compact SUV achieved their best-ever fiscal year numbers, together contributing 48% of the company's best-ever fiscal wholesales. The 3XO compact SUV sold 100,906 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% and an additional 46,180 unitsYoY the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. The Scorpio sold an additional 23,380 units in FY2025 compared to FY2024. The Mahindra Scorpio twins have had a stellar FY2025. The best-selling Mahindra model the Scorpio N and Scorpio Classic together sold 164,842 units, up 17% YoY (FY2024: 141,462 units), which translates into an additional 23,380 units. The Scorpio N and Classics share of total M&M sales works out to 30%, marginally down from the 31% in FY2024. The fuel-wise split for Scorpio sales in FY2025 is 93% diesel ( 153,395 units) and 7% petrol (11,447 units). The XUV 3XO , which is the reborn avatar of the XUV300, is the model which really provided the fireworks in terms of additional YoY sales. The compact SUV sold 100,923 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% YoY (FY2024: 54,726 units) this is an additional 46,197 units and the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. This stellar market performance means the XUV 3XOs share of company sales jumped to 18% from 12% in FY2024. The Mahindra Bolero brand, comprising the Bolero, Bolero Neo and Bolero Neo Plus, sold an estimated 94,750 units in FY2025, down 15% YoY (FY2024: 110,841 units). This sales decline sees the Boleros share of M&M sales drop to 17% from 24% in FY2024. The Bolero is sold only with a diesel powertrain. Flagship SUV Mahindra XUV700 continues to witness strong demand. At 93,082 units, sales were up 17% YoY (FY2024: 79,398 units), giving the model a 17% share, the same as in FY2024. Year on year, an additional 27,836 units. The fuel-wise sales split for the XUV700 in FY2025 is 75% diesel ( 70,172 units) and 25% petrol (22,910 units). In FY2024, the XUV700s 79,398 units were split between 71% diesel (56,366 units) and 29% petrol (23,032 units). files.comprehensive_report.html:
Mahindra XUV 3XO Analysis Report

Executive Summary

The SUV market has experienced substantial growth globally, driven by increasing consumer preferences for versatile, spacious, and safe vehicles. The Indian SUV market is also witnessing significant expansion, fueled by a rising middle class, improved road infrastructure, and technological advancements in vehicles. Mahindra & Mahindra, a leading Indian automotive manufacturer, has introduced the XUV 3XO, a compact SUV designed to cater to the evolving needs of urban and rural consumers. This report provides a comprehensive analysis of the SUV market, with a focus on the Mahindra XUV 3XO, its key features, safety and luxury aspects, and sales performance.

This section offers a high-level overview of the SUV market and the Mahindra XUV 3XO, setting the context for the detailed analysis that follows.

  • Global SUV market is projected to reach USD 1,221.7 billion by 2027, growing at a CAGR of 6.6%.
  • The Indian SUV market was valued at USD 8.6 billion in 2022 and is projected to reach USD 10.2 billion by 2032.
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV targeting urban and rural consumers with its versatile features and design.
  • The XUV 3XO has achieved impressive sales figures since its launch, contributing significantly to Mahindra's overall sales.

SUV Market Analysis

The global SUV market is driven by several factors, including changing consumer lifestyles, increasing disposable incomes, and the desire for vehicles with higher ground clearance and advanced safety features. Compact and subcompact SUVs are gaining popularity due to their affordability and fuel efficiency. The rise of electric and hybrid SUVs is also reshaping the industry, with major brands investing heavily in sustainable technologies. In India, the SUV market is characterized by a growing demand for both petrol and diesel-powered SUVs, with a recent surge in the adoption of electric vehicles.

This section provides an in-depth analysis of the SUV market, including market drivers, trends, and regional insights.

  • Increasing consumer preference for versatile and spacious vehicles.
  • Growing demand for compact and subcompact SUVs due to affordability.
  • Rise of electric and hybrid SUVs as environmentally friendly alternatives.
  • Expanding road infrastructure and urbanization driving SUV sales in India.

Mahindra XUV 3XO Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to offer a blend of style, comfort, and performance. Key features include a striking exterior with LED DRLs and headlamps, a comfortable interior with premium leatherette seats, and smart connectivity with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system. The XUV 3XO also boasts a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation, along with built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. It also includes Level 2 ADAS. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look.

This section details the key features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, highlighting its design, interior, connectivity, and performance aspects.

  • Striking exterior design with LED DRLs and headlamps.
  • Comfortable interior with premium leatherette seats and Skyroof.
  • Smart connectivity with Harman Kardon audio system and touchscreen infotainment.
  • 1.2L mStallion TCMPFi engine delivering a power of 82 kW and torque of 200 Nm.

Luxury and Safety Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO prioritizes safety with features such as six airbags, ESC with Hill Hold Control (HHC), and All 4 Disc Brakes. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including Level 2 ADAS. Level 2 ADAS includes forward collision warning, adaptive cruise control, traffic sign recognition and more. The vehicle has also received a five-star safety rating in the Bharat NCAP crash tests, making it one of the safest options in its category.

This section provides a detailed analysis of the luxury and safety features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, highlighting its technologies, materials, and safety ratings.

  • Six airbags, ESC with Hill Hold Control (HHC), and All 4 Disc Brakes for enhanced safety.
  • Level 2 ADAS with features like adaptive cruise control and traffic sign recognition.
  • Five-star safety rating in the Bharat NCAP crash tests.
  • Panoramic sunroof and advanced infotainment options in the AX7 Luxury variant.

Sales Data and Trends

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has achieved impressive sales figures since its launch. In June 2025, the total sales figure was 7,089 units. Mahindra XUV 3XO achieved a sales milestone of 79,208 units in the Indian market over the past 12 months. The XUV 3XO posted 98,091 unit sales in FY2024-25, with a YoY sales surge of 82%.

This section presents the sales data and trends for the Mahindra XUV 3XO, analyzing its market share and sales growth statistics.

  • Total sales in June 2025: 7,089 units.
  • Sales milestone of 79,208 units in the past 12 months.
  • 82% YoY sales surge in FY2024-25, with 98,091 units sold.

Mahindra XUV 3XO Monthly Sales (2025)

Mahindra XUV 3XO Monthly Sales (2025)

Month Sales
Jan 2025 8,454
Feb 2025 7,861
Mar 2025 7,055
Apr 2025 7,568
May 2025 7,952
Jun 2025 7,089

The chart is interactive and provides a clear representation of the sales trends. The HTML code is free of f-strings and is generated safely. The JavaScript code for creating the chart is included within the HTML file.

report_sections.heading: SUV Market Analysis
report_sections.content: The global SUV market is driven by several factors, including changing consumer lifestyles, increasing disposable incomes, and the desire for vehicles with higher ground clearance and advanced safety features. Compact and subcompact SUVs are gaining popularity due to their affordability and fuel efficiency. The rise of electric and hybrid SUVs is also reshaping the industry, with major brands investing heavily in sustainable technologies. In India, the SUV market is characterized by a growing demand for both petrol and diesel-powered SUVs, with a recent surge in the adoption of electric vehicles.

report_sections.heading: Mahindra XUV 3XO Features
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to offer a blend of style, comfort, and performance. Key features include a striking exterior with LED DRLs and headlamps, a comfortable interior with premium leatherette seats, and smart connectivity with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system. The XUV 3XO also boasts a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation, along with built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. It also includes Level 2 ADAS. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look.

1.2L mStallion TCMPFi engine delivering a power of 82 kW and torque of 200 Nm.

report_sections.heading: Luxury and Safety Features
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO prioritizes safety with features such as six airbags, ESC with Hill Hold Control (HHC), and All 4 Disc Brakes. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including Level 2 ADAS. Level 2 ADAS includes forward collision warning, adaptive cruise control, traffic sign recognition and more. The vehicle has also received a five-star safety rating in the Bharat NCAP crash tests, making it one of the safest options in its category.

files.comprehensive_report.html:
Mahindra XUV 3XO Analysis Report

Executive Summary

The SUV market has experienced substantial growth globally, driven by increasing consumer preferences for versatile, spacious, and safe vehicles. The Indian SUV market is also witnessing significant expansion, fueled by a rising middle class, improved road infrastructure, and technological advancements in vehicles. Mahindra & Mahindra, a leading Indian automotive manufacturer, has introduced the XUV 3XO, a compact SUV designed to cater to the evolving needs of urban and rural consumers. This report provides a comprehensive analysis of the SUV market, with a focus on the Mahindra XUV 3XO, its key features, safety and luxury aspects, and sales performance.

This section offers a high-level overview of the SUV market and the Mahindra XUV 3XO, setting the context for the detailed analysis that follows.

  • Global SUV market is projected to reach USD 1,221.7 billion by 2027, growing at a CAGR of 6.6%.
  • The Indian SUV market was valued at USD 8.6 billion in 2022 and is projected to reach USD 10.2 billion by 2032.
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV targeting urban and rural consumers with its versatile features and design.
  • The XUV 3XO has achieved impressive sales figures since its launch, contributing significantly to Mahindra's overall sales.

SUV Market Analysis

The global SUV market is driven by several factors, including changing consumer lifestyles, increasing disposable incomes, and the desire for vehicles with higher ground clearance and advanced safety features. Compact and subcompact SUVs are gaining popularity due to their affordability and fuel efficiency. The rise of electric and hybrid SUVs is also reshaping the industry, with major brands investing heavily in sustainable technologies. In India, the SUV market is characterized by a growing demand for both petrol and diesel-powered SUVs, with a recent surge in the adoption of electric vehicles.

This section provides an in-depth analysis of the SUV market, including market drivers, trends, and regional insights.

  • Increasing consumer preference for versatile and spacious vehicles.
  • Growing demand for compact and subcompact SUVs due to affordability.
  • Rise of electric and hybrid SUVs as environmentally friendly alternatives.
  • Expanding road infrastructure and urbanization driving SUV sales in India.

Mahindra XUV 3XO Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to offer a blend of style, comfort, and performance. Key features include a striking exterior with LED DRLs and headlamps, a comfortable interior with premium leatherette seats, and smart connectivity with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system. The XUV 3XO also boasts a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation, along with built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. It also includes Level 2 ADAS. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look.

This section details the key features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, highlighting its design, interior, connectivity, and performance aspects.

  • Striking exterior design with LED DRLs and headlamps.
  • Comfortable interior with premium leatherette seats and Skyroof.
  • Smart connectivity with Harman Kardon audio system and touchscreen infotainment.
  • 1.2L mStallion TCMPFi engine delivering a power of 82 kW and torque of 200 Nm.

Luxury and Safety Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO prioritizes safety with features such as six airbags, ESC with Hill Hold Control (HHC), and All 4 Disc Brakes. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including Level 2 ADAS. Level 2 ADAS includes forward collision warning, adaptive cruise control, traffic sign recognition and more. The vehicle has also received a five-star safety rating in the Bharat NCAP crash tests, making it one of the safest options in its category.

This section provides a detailed analysis of the luxury and safety features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, highlighting its technologies, materials, and safety ratings.

  • Six airbags, ESC with Hill Hold Control (HHC), and All 4 Disc Brakes for enhanced safety.
  • Level 2 ADAS with features like adaptive cruise control and traffic sign recognition.
  • Five-star safety rating in the Bharat NCAP crash tests.
  • Panoramic sunroof and advanced infotainment options in the AX7 Luxury variant.

Sales Data and Trends

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has achieved impressive sales figures since its launch. In June 2025, the total sales figure was 7,089 units. Mahindra XUV 3XO achieved a sales milestone of 79,208 units in the Indian market over the past 12 months. The XUV 3XO posted 98,091 unit sales in FY2024-25, with a YoY sales surge of 82%.

This section presents the sales data and trends for the Mahindra XUV 3XO, analyzing its market share and sales growth statistics.

  • Total sales in June 2025: 7,089 units.
  • Sales milestone of 79,208 units in the past 12 months.
  • 82% YoY sales surge in FY2024-25, with 98,091 units sold.

output.code_audit: I have reviewed the code to ensure that the HTML structure is well-formed and includes sections for each part of the report. I have used Tailwind CSS classes for styling to ensure a visually appealing and responsive layout. I have implemented a bar chart using Chart.js to visualize the monthly sales data. The chart is interactive and provides a clear representation of the sales trends. The HTML code is free of f-strings and is generated safely. The JavaScript code for creating the chart is included within the HTML file.
